description: Burgeoning cities and industrialism, an emerging market economy, changing opportunities for
women, an influx of immigrants, and the migration of African Americans to urban centers -- all
opened questions of freedom of expression, distribution of resources, and American identity.
Topics and texts range from the Statue of Liberty and the World's Columbian Exposition to the
Model T Ford and the Harlem Renaissance. Prerequisite: AMCON 101 and 102.  Offered annually
in the fall semester. Counts towards American studies major.
